title: Othellobit
author: Othellobit
content: I have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency. I also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this?

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMI have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency.Don't believe him if he only talk about his success. Cryptocurrency market is not a heaven for everyone.QuoteI also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this? As a newbie, learn with Bitcoin first.Investing in Bitcoin first.After about four years and get good profit with Bitcoin investment, you can use 10% of it to start Spot trading. Don't use margin.Do never use all your money for altcoin investment or trading with altcoins. They will make you poorer.Read books.The Internet of money https://www.amazon.com/Internet-Money-Andreas-M-Antonopoulos/dp/1537000454The little Bitcoin book https://www.amazon.com/Little-Bitcoin-Book-Matters-Finances/dp/1641990503Mastering Bitcoin https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMI have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency. I also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this? You'd better learn to take risk if you want to make something different from what you've been having, but you can minimize this risk by going for bitcoin first being a newbie, then later when you think you've got a thicker skin in crypto and in taking risk you can go for some other cryptocurrencies as well, but everything begins with a step, take the first and bold step to learn and know that you've acquired something about bitcoin before investing, if you ask your friend again, he will tells you how long he has been in the system and the level of risk he had taken, before getting to where he is now.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMI have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency.Does a friend of yours speak so much of how his life has become much better ever since he joined bitcoin?If yes, have you also witnessed what he said to you? Does his life actually improve after he joined Bitcoin? Or is he just saying sweet words to entice you to join Bitcoin? I think the later is meaningless because bitcoin is not a Ponzi scheme and is not a referral program. Whether you join bitcoin or not, it does not add anything to his success and neither does it subtract. So you have to meet your friend to know more about bitcoin. It is not all about earning you have to learn first before you earn.Try and read the books shared to you by dzungmobile

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PM I also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this? Even though everyone here believes that Bitcoin is not going anywhere and that it will be worth much more than it is worth now, it is still a fact that its a high risk investment. It is normal to be afraid to be afraid of something that you don't know much about so what you can do is educate yourself about all the pros and cons and if you are still afraid and think that you can't handle the volatility and being responsible for safety of your money, better stay away from it.

comments.author: Wakate
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMI have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency. I also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this?  You don't need to be scared of investing in Bitcoin. Bitcoin investment is just like the other investment that we put our money in. You need to make an if you want to invest in Bitcoin and you just don't have to enter the market and come out without knowing the next direction of price and where price is going. You would also need to learn about the cryptocurrency market so that you will be able to measure your risks and plan how to execute your target that it will be affect your holding. Have it in your mind that Bitcoin investment is risky and entering into the market is at your own risk.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMBut as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this?  I think you entertain such FUD because probably you feel the best way to meet up is to invest all you've got which is not advisable since to trade or invest in Bitcoin is to do it with an amount you can easily part with thanks to the volatility rate of it.  Secondly, nothing meaningful in life is worth it without engaging in some form of risk. Learn about Bitcoin first do it gives you a background knowledge of what you are heading into.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 03:40:52 PMBut u have spoken about minimizing risk, and in other to do that you recommended Bitcoin. Do u mean there is lesser or no risk in Bitcoin compared to other crypto?Lesser risk. Bitcoin represents 14 years of Blockchain advancement and has been the most valuable for all of that time. There is a real product and has maintained the exact same process for all of that time while getting more secure and more valued. Other cryptocurrencies are copies of existing ones, only few having an original idea, but still falling short in security or decentralization. The chances of a good investment with them is not favorable.Bitcoin has a fixed supply and is not vulnerable to inflation.- Jay -

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMI have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency. I also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this?  You cannot see changes in your life if you stay living in your comfort zone. Take some risk too so you will develop challenges in your life that will give you more motivation to succeed. And you can only do that if you start being knowledgeable in the crypto market at first. By knowing a lot about bitcoin and other potential cryptocurrencies, you will be aware of their risks so you start learning on how to manage the risks by then. Little by little, you will understand how crypto investment works and when you fully grasp its whole idea, then you can start taking some calculated risk and invest in crypto. But take them as long term investments because that’s the best way you can earn from them.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: What you’re experiencing now is called FOMO (fear of missing out). Bitcoin is a high risk investment, there are no guarantees you will be successful. Your friend told you high parts of the story and didn’t mention the lows. There is too much misinformation about bitcoin, newbies are attracted to these braggadocious characters and influencers claiming to be bitcoin experts and millionaires. At the end of the day, the newbies are sold on one Altcoin or the other.

comments.author: tech30338
comments.body: Quote from: Othellobit on March 09, 2023, 02:59:25 PMI have a friend who speaks so much about how good he's life has become ever since he explored the world of BTC and other crypto currency. I also have the desire to get the benefits of Bitcoin and other crypto currency. but as a newbie, I still have this fear that I may not be able to withstand the risk involved. Can anyone advice me on this? Why are you afraid to take risk? you already done so many risk in your life that you just don't realize that everyday you are at risk, its only your mind that saying you have not done it yet, the only thing that you may regret is you have not take the shot earlier, we all afraid of risk its normal, but we still do it, you have no idea what your friend have to endure to make where he is now, we may see his success but the nights where he can't sleep, stress, thinking what will happen to him is just in the background, taking risk is part of our life, let me tell you a short story about me, i only got 600$ got some other cash but its reserve for emergency, during first 4 months of 2021 still in pandemic, I have to help, to pay the bills, but i have to cover the last 1 and half year, i have to take a risk and bet on a coin which some say is a shitcoin, i don't listen to them, and do my research, hold the coin for a month, i don't expect it will spike that much, turn the money to 5 digits, and help me out a bit, lost some but keep others to help pay rents etc., as you can see, you have to take risk, sometimes but always have a backup plan, im not saying you go all in, but keep some just incase, as you see taking risk is part of our life, take it no regrets, learn from it, do not dwell on failure, take it as inspiration to move up.I hope this will help you decide, but no matter what its still your call, we are just here to give are advice, and experience good luck.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Exploration or learning will consume your time at very least, some people even spend a lot money since they're invested on a scam project. If you're educated enough, you can minimize the risk and not fall into scam, but you can just lose for small amount money to try anything because practice is better than theory. Just like you can try to trade in leverage exchange, send transaction with different address format etc.
